steps.title: Crush berries by hand in a sterile plastic bucket.
steps.content: Crush berries by hand in a sterile plastic bucket. Pour in 2 US pints (950 ml) of cooled distilled water and mix well. Leave mixture for two hours.

steps.title: Boil one third of the sugar with 3 US pints (1,000 ml) water for one minute.
steps.content: Boil one third of the sugar with 3 US pints (1,000 ml) water for one minute. [1] X Research source Allow syrup to cool.

steps.title: Add yeast to 4 oz of warm (not boiling) water and stand for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Add yeast to 4 oz of warm (not boiling) water and stand for 10 minutes.

steps.title: Pour the cooled syrup into the berries.
steps.content: Pour the cooled syrup into the berries. Add the yeast. Make sure the mixture has properly cooled, as a hot temperature will kill the yeast. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Cover the bucket with a clean cloth and leave in a warm place for seven days.
steps.content: Cover the bucket with a clean cloth and leave in a warm place for seven days.

steps.title: Strain pulp through fine muslin or another fine straining device, wringing the material dry.
steps.content: Strain pulp through fine muslin or another fine straining device, wringing the material dry. Use the pulp as compost .

steps.title: Pour the strained liquid into a gallon jug.
steps.content: Pour the strained liquid into a gallon jug.

steps.title: Boil a second 1/3 of the sugar in 1 US-pint (470 ml) water.
steps.content: Boil a second 1/3 of the sugar in 1 US-pint (470 ml) water. Allow it to cool before adding it to the jug.

steps.title: Plug the top of jug with cotton wool and stretch a pin-pricked balloon to the neck.
steps.content: Plug the top of jug with cotton wool and stretch a pin-pricked balloon to the neck. This allows CO2 to escape and to protects the wine from oxidization and outside contamination.

steps.title: Let the wine sit for ten days.
steps.content: Let the wine sit for ten days. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Siphon or rack the wine to a container.
steps.content: Siphon or rack the wine to a container. Sterilize the jug, then return the wine.

steps.title: Boil the remaining 1/3 sugar in the last pint of water, allowing to cool before adding to the wine.
steps.content: Boil the remaining 1/3 sugar in the last pint of water, allowing to cool before adding to the wine.

steps.title: Plug the jug with the cotton wool and balloon and leave until the wine has stopped fermenting.
steps.content: Plug the jug with the cotton wool and balloon and leave until the wine has stopped fermenting. The wine will stop bubbling when fermentation has stopped.

steps.title: Siphon
steps.content: Siphon the wine as before. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Sterilize the wine bottles and add a funnel.
steps.content: Sterilize the wine bottles and add a funnel. [5] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Pour the wine into the bottles, filling each bottle to the neck.
steps.content: Pour the wine into the bottles, filling each bottle to the neck.

steps.title: Cork and store the bottles.
steps.content: Cork and store the bottles. [6] X Research source
